commit_message:
Introduce fixture to enforce sorted order for object changes

In unit tests, sometimes you want to compare that JSON representation of
an object is identical to a JSON blob. Sadly, it may not work for
objects with changes made, since those changes are represented in the
object as a set, and hence end up in unstable order in JSON blobs.

To facilitate smooth object representation comparison for objects using
__eq__, this fixture enforces sorting for object changes.

Note: this code is directly ripped from Nova tree, with tiny
modifications:

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/tests/fixtures.py?id=dd36b6474ee9d70636fd4bc5f30237de2151fc45#n571

subject: Finish the Python 3 port
commit_message:
Finish the Python 3 port

with this change, all unit and functional tests pass on Python 3.4.

* WSGI middleware: on Python 3, decode the error message from UTF-8.
* Replace json.dumps() with jsonutils.dump_as_bytes() of
  oslo_serialization to get bytes on Python 3.
* monitor_service.py, test_monitor.py: Fix usage of tooz, pass byte
  strings to the coordinator API.
* Fix nova and neutron fixtures: replace dict.values() with
  list(dict.values()) to get list on Python 3.
* Fix urllib2_fixture: On Python 3, replace urllib2 with
  urllib.request.
* test_create_cluster.py: don't sort exception types, but use a set
  instead to compare them. On Python 3, comparison between exception
  types now raises a TypeError.
* test_wsme_objects.py: catch also TypeError on wsme validation. On
  Python 3, comparison between the new attribute value and the
  minimum raises a TypeError which is not wrapped into a
  InvalidInput exception of wsme. See also the change
  I74103330ccb5cdc26aa3508fcefcc34310e00c27 which proposes to wrap
  TypeError.
* install_rabbit.sh.tmpl: replace dict.iteritems() with dict.items().
* Replace generator.next() with next(generator).
* Replace reduce() with six.moves.reduce()
* Replace "str is 'URLError'" test with "str == 'URLError'", using is
  to compare strings is not reliable.

docs: Remove warnings from "api-ref"

When building the docs or the api-ref, these warnings (among others)
will occur:

    api-ref/source/servers.rst:102: WARNING:
    duplicate label
    list-servers-lists-ids-names-and-links-for-all-servers-selector,
    other instance in ~/git/nova/api-ref/source/servers.rst

    checking consistency...
    ~/git/nova/api-ref/source/servers.rst::
    WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree

This is due to the usage of ".. include::" in combination with the
"conf.py" setting "source_suffix = '.rst'". The duplicate detection
of sphinx will find then the labels twice, in "servers.rst" and also
"index.rst". Also sphinx doesn't find the *.rst files in any toctree.

The "include" directive got chosen to build one single document out of
multiple other documents (servers.rst + versions.rst). This change
alters the file extension of the included files to "*.inc", which
seems to be common practice of others who want to achive the same
result. This also solves the toctree warning. It keeps the "api-ref"
source open for other "*.rst" files which are not intented to be
included with the ".. included::" directive.

The commands "tox -e api-ref" and "tox -e docs" will now run without
warnings. Which enables us to also treat future warnings as errors,
hence the "tox.ini" build targets can use the "-W" flag.

To make the results reproducible, we remove previous build results
via "tox.ini" commands enhancement "rm -rf".

subject: Wait for the interfaces to get IP addresses before inspection
commit_message:
Wait for the interfaces to get IP addresses before inspection

In the DIB build the DHCP code (provided by the dhcp-all-interfaces element)
races with the service starting IPA. It does not matter for deployment itself,
as we're waiting for the route to the Ironic API to appear. However, for
inspection it may result in reporting back all NIC's without IP addresses.
Inspection fails in this case.

This change makes inspection wait for *all* NIC's to get their IP addresses up
to a small timeout. The timeout is 60 seconds by default and can be changed
via the new ipa-inspection-dhcp-wait-timeout kernel option (0 to not wait).

After the wait inspection proceedes in any case, so the worst downside
is making inspection 60 seconds longer.

To avoid waiting for NIC's that are not even connected, this change extends the
NetworkInterface class with 'has_carrier' field.

- IPAllocationPool
- IPAllocation
- IPAvailabilityRange
And reference ipam driver has counterpart models with similar scructure:
- IpamSubnet
- IpamAllocationPool
- IpamAllocation
- IpamAvailabilityRange
IpamSubnet has different ids comparing to Subnet model, so during data
migration remapping from neutron_subnet_id to ipam_subnet_id is needed.
IpamSubnet does not have index on neutron_subnet_id field, so joining
by this field would be extremely slow. To achieve O(1) time for lookup
neutron_subnet_id to ipam_subnet_id mapping is stored as a dict during
execution of migrate script.

Data migration can be done in both directions:
- 'neutron-migrate-ipam-to-pluggable' - migrates data from built-in to
  pluggable
- 'neutron-migrate-ipam-to-built-in' - migrates data from pluggable to
  built-in

By default availability ranges are recalculated during migration.
It is done because source table that contains availability ranges can
become out-of-date in case of switching ipam backend multiple times.
All other 'built-in' ipam tables are receiving updates even
if pluggable ipam driver is used (these tables are API exposed and
still have to be updated).

Rebuilding availability ranges is slower than direct data copying.
If migration time is critical operator can specify '--quick' flag
to force direct data copying. This option applies only for
'neutron-migrate-ipam-to-pluggable' script and it is safe to use only
if ipam backend is switched the first time.

Added release notes with steps to migrate from built-in ipam to
pluggable ipam.

Note:
Currently migration script is tested in dependent patch, where
ipam_driver is set to default. For now
neutron-migrate-ipam-to-pluggable is called from alembic migration on
upgrade in gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron.

Previously we tried to use UpdateIdentifier for two different things:
tell whether to perform package update, and also to tell whether the
top-level stack is being created or updated (which was incorrect and
resulted in bug 1567384, and an attempt to work around that bug resulted
in bug 1567385).

usage: openstack stack create [-h]

                              [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>]
[--noindent]
                              [--prefix PREFIX] -t <template>

                              [--parameter <key=value>]
                              [--parameter-file <key=file>] [--wait]
                              [--tags <tag1,tag2...>] [--dry-run]

subject: Include query string in request logging
commit_message:
Include query string in request logging

While debugging openstacksdk, I noticed that the way we send query
parameters in a request led to them not being included in the URL that
gets logged within _http_log_request. When the `url` directly includes
the query string, it of course gets logged. When a caller utilizes the
`params` argument (set to a dictionary of query parameters), which is
subsequently handled inside of the requests library, those parameters
don't end up getting logged.

This change grabs any query parameters out of the `params` argument and
sends them into the log method. The resulting output of a url with
included query strings is wrapped in double quotes so the CURL command
that gets logged is actually runnable, because the question mark
separator is interpreted by the shell.

subject: DVR: Clear stale SNAT namespace when agent restarts after router move
commit_message:
DVR: Clear stale SNAT namespace when agent restarts after router move

When we move (manual move) a router from one dvr_snat node to
another dvr_snat node the snat_namespace should be removed by
the originating node by the agent and will be recreated in the
destination node by the destination agent.

But when the agent dies, the router_update message cannot reach
the agent and so the snat_namespace is untouched.

After the agent restarts, the agent should remove the
snat_namespace since it is no more hosted by the current agent.

Even though we do have the agent take care of stale namespaces on
a agent restart, this particular use case is not handled right.

This patch provides a fix for cleaning up just the snat namespace
on the dvr_snat node where the router binding was removed.

subject: Add canvas timeline implementation
commit_message:
Add canvas timeline implementation

This adds a new timeline renderer using a plain canvas element,
replacing the d3 and svg-based renderer. This new implementation
greatly improves timeline performance, especially on less powerful
graphics cards, and more than doubles the resulting framerate while
panning the view by aggressively caching previously rendered chart
regions. Additionally, worst-case memory usage is greatly reduced
during heavier periods of user interaction.

This new implementation also removes several previous limitations.
Due to cached rendering a nearly unlimited number of objects can be
shown at any time with no performance impact, so small objects never
need to be hidden from view at any zoom level. Also, view transitions
can now be smoothly animated, and reach a stable framerate even on
older mobile devices.
